question: In which year Nagaland was added as a state of the Union of India?
explanation: Nagaland attained statehood with the enactment of the state of Nagaland Act in 1962 by the Parliament. The interim body was dissolved on 30 November 1963 and the state of Nagaland was formally inaugurated on 1 December 1963 and Kohima was declared as the state capital. It became the 16th State of the Union of India on 1st December 1963.
